intro: Amblyanthera funiformis var. peduncularis, commonly known as the slender amblyanthera, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its elongated, pendulous inflorescences and small, showy flowers with five petals. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a velvety texture. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in understory vegetation of tropical forests.
